citation.article-title: Transfer of Methanogenium bourgense, Methanogenium marisnigri, Methanogenium olentangyi, and Methanogenium thermophilicum to the genus Methanoculleus gen. nov., emendation of Methanoculleus marisnigri and Methanogenium, and description of new strains of Methanoculleus bourgense and Methanoculleus marisnigri.

p.s: Description of Methanoculleus bourgense comb. nov.
Methanoculleus bourgense (bourg.en'se. N. L. neut. adj. bourgense, from Bourg-en-Bresse, France)
Strains are coccoid methanogens which grow on H2-CO2, on formate, and sometimes on secondary alcohols; acetate is a growth factor.
Cells are 1 to 2 μm in diameter and grow best at mesophilic temperatures, at neutral pH values, and at Na+ concentrations below 0.3 M.
Recognized habitats are limited to anaerobic digestors.
Strain MS2 (= DSM 3045 = OGC 15) is the type strain, and strain LX1 (= OGC 24) is a reference strain.
